task_agent_pairs.task_name: search for news articles on a specific topic
task_agent_pairs.task_description: Search for recent news articles about the topic the user is interested in, and return a list of headlines, publishers, publication dates, and URLs for each article.

primary.name: Orbimesh News Agent
primary.description: Fetches news articles from a wide range of sources via the NewsAPI. It can search for articles on any topic or retrieve top business headlines from specific countries.
capabilities: search for news articles on a specific topic
get top business headlines from a country

endpoints.description: Searches for news articles matching a keyword or query. Ideal for finding news about a specific company, person, or event.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search keyword or phrase (e.g., 'Tesla', 'stock market trends').

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The 2-letter ISO-639-1 code of the language you want to get articles in (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (maximum 100).

endpoints.description: Provides live top business headlines for a specific country.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country you want to get headlines for (e.g., 'us', 'gb', 'in').

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (maximum 100).

fallbacks.name: ScholarAI Agent
fallbacks.description: A powerful research assistant that interacts with the ScholarAI API. It can perform semantic searches for scholarly papers, read full-text documents, analyze entire projects with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and manage research projects.
capabilities: search for scholarly papers and abstracts
read the full text of a paper
analyze a project of papers with specific questions
add a paper to a research project

endpoints.description: Retrieves relevant abstracts and metadata for scholarly papers by semantic search. It can also generate a summary of the papers.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Search keywords for articles (must be in English).

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The natural language query or question that the search results should answer.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order to sort the results by. Can be 'relevance', 'cited_by_count', or 'publication_date'.

parameters.name: peer_reviewed_only
parameters.description: Set to true to only return peer-reviewed articles.

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The starting year for the search range (inclusive).

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The ending year for the search range (inclusive).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The pagination offset for the search results.

endpoints.description: Retrieves the full text of a paper, returned in sections or 'chunks'. Can also retrieve associated figures and images.

parameters.name: pdf_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the PDF, prefixed with 'PDF_URL:' or 'PROJ:'.

parameters.name: chunk
parameters.description: The section or chunk number of the text to retrieve.

endpoints.description: Analyzes all papers within a specified project to answer one or more questions using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The name of the project to analyze.

parameters.name: analysis_mode
parameters.description: The analysis mode. Can be 'comprehensive' for a detailed report or 'tabular' for a structured table.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: A list of one or more questions to be answered for each paper in the project.

endpoints.description: Adds a paper to a specified research project using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: The paper identifier (e.g., DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV).

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The name of the project to add the paper to. Defaults to the 'GPT' project if not specified.

parsed_tasks.task_description: Search for recent news articles about the topic the user is interested in, and return a list of headlines, publishers, publication dates, and URLs for each article.
